content.question: Consider the sequence <math alttext="a, sub k, equals, the square root of k plus 1, end root, minus the square root of k, which equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of k plus 1, end root, plus the square root of k, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as k approaches infinity, of a, sub k, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> converges.

<math alttext="the limit as k approaches infinity, of a, sub k, is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> converges.

<math alttext="the limit as k approaches infinity, of a, sub k, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> diverges.

<math alttext="the limit as k approaches infinity, of a, sub k, is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> diverges.
